body: Hi @Amyloida, could you activate your environment and show the output of `conda list`?

@Amyloida can you also confirm you are using this conda file (note, it is new for rc2.3) https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/tree/master/conda-environments 

Note, in the future please search for the exact error message, as you will see there are other issues, and it would be better to post under them, vs. opening a new issue, thanks! 

https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/587
https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1434
https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1368
https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/587

rename.from: ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'. Use pip or conda to install tables.
rename.to: `ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'. Use pip or conda to install tables.`

hi @Amyloida seems it is conda installed in the environment; can you run: `pip3 install git+https://github.com/PyTables/PyTables` maybe for some reason that version is not working as expected...

The problem is mentioned and solved in the first entry in #1368. Your pytables was installed by conda, as shown in your conda list output. Existing environments can be fixed by removing that version, and installing from pip

```
conda uninstall pytables
pip install tables
```

This does not happen with new environments since the yaml was fixed, unpinning pytables from conda in #1400.

issue.title: no .h5 files created after labelling

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### Bug description

Hi DeepLabCut!
Firstly, thank you for taking the time to read this. 

I am trying to train a model on the new version of DLC (2.2rc3). Everything went well and I have labelled all my frames with no issues. However, I have tried create the training dataset (with GUI default choices) and I got an error, no .h5 file. I have checked within the labelled images folder and it has created a .csv with all the co-ordinates but no .h5! Why is this? How can I fix this! I can't train without it!

(I am using the most up to date version of deeplabcut (windows) with a GPU. I have trained multiple times on this laptop using my GPU with no issue)

Charlotte 

### Operating System

operating system: Windows 

### DeepLabCut version

dlc version: 2.2rc3

### DeepLabCut mode

multi animal

### Device type

gpu: NVIDA 

### Steps To Reproduce

1. activate DEEPLABCUT
2. ipython
3. import deeplabcut
4. deeplabcut.launch_dlc()
5. create training dataset (GUI)
6. error:  File C:\Users\cw266\Videos\gorilla_rotations-charlotte-2021-07-01\labeled-data\gorilla1\CollectedData_charlotte.h5 does not exist 
(have checked the folders, it does not exist for any video in the dataset)

### Relevant log output

_No response_

### Anything else?

_No response_

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md)

body:
ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'.  Use pip or conda to install tables.
I ran these commands:

conda uninstall pytables
pip install tables

but the error still there.
how to fix it?
(deeplabcut[gui] version is 2.2.0.2)

issue.title: ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'.  Use pip or conda to install tables.

repository.name: DeepLabCut
repository.description: Official implementation of DeepLabCut: Markerless pose estimation of user-defined features with deep learning for all animals incl. humans

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
ImportError: Missing optional dependency 'tables'.  Use pip or conda to install tables.
I ran these commands:

conda uninstall pytables
pip install tables

but the error still there.
how to fix it?
(deeplabcut[gui] version is 2.2.0.2)

_Originally posted by @Jason66661010 in https://github.com/DeepLabCut/DeepLabCut/issues/1445#issuecomment-967780171_
